description: Borrowed from Hindi कुरता (kurtā)/Urdu کرتا‎ (kurtā), from Persian کرته‎ (korte).

entries.meaning: A traditional article of clothing worn in Afghanistan, Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka, consisting of a loose, collarless, long-sleeved, knee-length shirt worn by both men and women.
examples: Now her fingers began to unbutton the ivory studs that ran slantwise across the chest of his kurta.
